day_62.abstract: Israel appeared on the verge of a constitutional crisis Tuesday as top members of Benjamin Netanyahu's Likud urged their party colleague and parliament speaker to defy a Supreme Court order to let lawmakers hold a vote for his successor.

day_62.headline: I’m a Calamity Obsessive. After My Trip to Italy, I Was the Calamity.
day_62.abstract: I wasn’t planning to be on vacation in a pandemic. It changed the way I’ll think about risk forever.

day_62.headline: Business Fallout: Nike Cites Jump in Online Sales in China
day_62.abstract: The rapid spread of the coronavirus since it was first reported in China has dealt an unprecedented shock to the global economy. Here's a look at developments Tuesday as central banks, businesses and workers attempt to navigate a global outbreak that has brought economic activity to a standstill.

day_62.headline: Stocks Surge on Hopes for Economic Rescue Deal
day_62.abstract: Live updates on stock market and business news during the coronavirus outbreak.

day_63.headline: Corona Shutdown Strands Thousands at Istanbul Airport
day_63.abstract: Around 2,000 people have been stranded for a week at Istanbul Airport by a shutdown of flights to stem the spread of coronavirus, the airport's operator said on Wednesday.

day_63.headline: German Cathedral Dusts Off Relics of St Corona, Patron of Epidemics
day_63.abstract: Germany's Aachen Cathedral has dug out the relics of little-known Saint Corona, patron saint of resisting epidemics, from its treasure chamber and is polishing up her elaborate shrine to go on show once the coronavirus pandemic has passed.

day_63.headline: Club Med Takes on the Frugals in EU 'Corona Bond' Bailout Battle
day_63.abstract: Leaders of nine EU countries urged the bloc on Wednesday to issue a "common debt instrument" to cushion their economies from the shock of the coronavirus crisis, challenging Germany and others adamantly opposed to pooling risk across the continent.

day_63.headline: Thyssenkrupp to Cut 3,000 Jobs at Steel Unit by 2026
day_63.abstract: The German elevator-to-car parts conglomerate Thyssenkrupp will cut 3,000 jobs at its steel unit by 2026 as part of a wage deal it struck with powerful labor union IG Metall, it said on Wednesday.

day_63.headline: Nine EU Leaders Call for Joint Debt Issuance for Coronavirus Spending
day_63.abstract: Leaders of nine EU countries including France, Italy and Spain called on the bloc to agree on a "common debt instrument" to raise funds to support the health industry in combating the coronavirus, as well as the broader economies, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

day_63.headline: New Jersey Slaps Terror Charge on Man Over Alleged Supermarket Cough Threat
day_63.abstract: A New Jersey man has been charged with making terroristic threats after he was accused of coughing on a supermarket employee and saying he was infected with the coronavirus behind the ongoing pandemic, authorities said Tuesday.

day_63.headline: In Japan, Hotels Lose Out on Olympic Bet as Coronavirus Spreads
day_63.abstract: The Osaka Corona Hotel in western Japan has been eerily quiet and empty the past few weeks.

day_63.headline: Refugees to the Rescue? Germany Taps Migrant Medics to Battle Virus
day_63.abstract: Five years ago the arrival of a wave of refugees caused much consternation and fueled support for Germany's far-right. Now, the country is turning to its migrant community to plug an anticipated shortage of medical staff battling the coronavirus.

day_63.headline: Neighbors Are Reaching Out on Nextdoor
day_63.abstract: Homebound city dwellers are turning to a neighborhood app to connect, organize and help each other without risking physical contact.

day_63.headline: Saudis Tighten Anti-Virus Curfew; UAE Closures Leave Travellers Stranded
day_63.abstract: Saudi Arabia reported its second coronavirus death and tightened a nationwide curfew on Wednesday, barring travel in and out of Riyadh, the capital, and the holy cities of Mecca and Medina, as well as movement between all provinces.

day_64.headline: Bosch Develops Corona Test Tool to Detect Virus in Under Three Hours
day_64.abstract: Robert Bosch on Thursday said it has developed a diagnostic tool for detecting the coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 in under three hours, potentially aiding the challenge of understanding how far the virus has spread.

day_64.headline: 'Most Photographed' NYSE Trader Contracts Coronavirus
day_64.abstract: Peter Tuchman, dubbed the "most photographed trader on Wall Street", took to Instagram on Thursday to tell his 10,000-odd followers that he had tested positive for coronavirus.

day_64.headline: German Baker Cleans Up With Toilet Roll Cakes
day_64.abstract: A German baker has drummed up some much-needed demand during the coronavirus crisis by making cakes in the shape of toilet rolls.

day_64.headline: Internet Firm Restricts Virus-Themed Website Registrations
day_64.abstract: An internet firm is ending the automated registration of website names that include words or phrases related to the COVID-19 pandemic, an attempt to combat coronavirus-related fraud.

day_64.headline: Germany Still in Calm Before Coronavirus Storm: Health Minister
day_64.abstract: Germany is still in "the calm before the storm" of the coronavirus epidemic and is using the time it has won with extensive testing to prepare for a wave of cases expected in the coming weeks, Health Minister Jens Spahn said on Thursday.

day_64.headline: Lebanon Extends Coronavirus Lockdown by Two Weeks
day_64.abstract: Lebanon is extending a lockdown by two weeks until April 12 to combat the spread of the coronavirus, its information minister  said on Thursday, while introducing strict new steps that seemed to amount to an overnight curfew in all but name.

day_64.headline: LeBron Talks About Virus' Impact on NBA in Podcast
day_64.abstract: Los Angeles Lakers superstar LeBron James shed light on a variety of topics facing the NBA should it attempt to resume the 2019-20 season later this year.

day_64.headline: Crisis Management Boosts Merkel's Conservatives in Poll
day_64.abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel's conservative bloc has risen in public opinion thanks to the government's management of the coronavirus crisis, with a poll on Thursday putting it at the highest level since a 2017 federal election.

day_64.headline: Here’s a Coronavirus Quiz
day_64.abstract: Test your currency with current events.

day_64.headline: Fearing Coronavirus, African City Dwellers Flee to the Countryside
day_64.abstract: Each morning at a crowded bus station east of Nairobi, Kenyans load their bags on to minibuses emblazoned with the faces of pop stars and Jesus, heading to their villages in the hope of escaping the coronavirus.

day_65.headline: Europol: Criminals Exploit Virus Crisis as Fresh Opportunity
day_65.abstract: Criminals are preying on a fearful public and disrupting the provision of medical care during the coronavirus pandemic by selling counterfeit products, impersonating health workers and hacking computers as many citizens do their jobs online at home, European law enforcement agency Europol said Friday.

day_65.headline: Of ‘Covidivorces’ and ‘Coronababies’: Life During a Lockdown
day_65.abstract: Across the world, the pandemic is radically altering approaches to love, dating, sex and family relations.

day_65.headline: European Shares Fall After Three-Day Rally, but Mark Best Week Since 2011
day_65.abstract: European shares closed in the red on Friday after EU lawmakers failed to agree on a coronavirus rescue package and British Prime Minister Boris Johnson announced he had been infected.

day_65.headline: Hedge Fund Fir Tree Puts $410 Million Dislocation Fund to Work
day_65.abstract: After years of waiting and watching from afar, hedge fund Fir Tree Partners is spending $410 million from its dislocation funds on stocks, pockets of the credit market and other securities, sure the historic market sell-off made new bargains.

day_65.headline: Germany Looks at Tracking Patients to Rein in Coronavirus-Reports
day_65.abstract: Germany has proposed using big data and location tracking to isolate people with coronavirus once social distancing measures now in force have slowed its spread, media reported on Friday.

day_65.headline: In Iran, False Belief a Poison Fights Virus Kills Hundreds
day_65.abstract: Standing over the still body of an intubated 5-year-old boy wearing nothing but a plastic diaper, an Iranian health care worker in a hazmat suit and mask begged the public for just one thing: Stop drinking industrial alcohol over fears about the new coronavirus.

day_65.headline: It’s Not All Bad. Here’s Proof.
day_65.abstract: We’re highlighting some of the more heartening things that caught our attention as the world mobilizes against the coronavirus pandemic.

day_65.headline: U.S. Companies, Labs Rush to Produce Blood Test for Coronavirus Immunity
day_65.abstract: As the United States works overtime to screen thousands for the novel coronavirus, a new blood test offers the chance to find out who may have immunity - a potential game changer in the battle to contain infections and get the economy back on track.

day_65.headline: A Riding Center for the Disabled Struggles to Care for Its Herd
day_65.abstract: An organization that provides therapeutic riding lessons for people with disabilities said a tearful goodbye amid fears over the spread of coronavirus.

day_65.headline: NOT REAL NEWS: Debunking Yet More False Coronavirus Content
day_65.abstract: A roundup of some of the most popular but completely untrue stories and visuals of the week. None of these are legit, even though they were shared widely on social media. The Associated Press checked them out. Here are the facts:

day_66.headline: Syria Bans Most Domestic Travel in Coronavirus Lockdown
day_66.abstract: Syria said on Friday it was banning travel between cities and governorates as part of tightening measures to curb the spread of coronavirus, state-run Ikhbariya TV reported, citing the interior minister.

day_66.headline: Lebanon's Berri May Suspend Cabinet Support Over Coronavirus Expat Policy
day_66.abstract: Lebanese Parliament Speaker Nabih Berri threatened on Saturday to suspend his support for Prime Minister Hassan Diab's government if it did not act to bring home expatriates stranded abroad during the coronavirus pandemic.

day_66.headline: Iran to Use 20% of State Budget to Fight Coronavirus
day_66.abstract: Iran is to allocate 20% of its annual state budget to fighting the coronavirus outbreak in the country, one of the worst-hit in the world, President Hassan Rouhani said on Saturday.

day_66.headline: A Wall. A Ball. That’s All: Your New Social-Distancing Workout
day_66.abstract: Long-ignored vertical slabs all over the city are having a moment.

day_66.headline: Finding Comfort in a Bottle of Familiar Wine
day_66.abstract: In times of fear and anxiety, we find solace in foods that conjure up memories and emotions. Why not wines?

day_66.headline: Parents Work on the Front Lines. Where Do Their Children Go All Day?
day_66.abstract: An experimental program attempts to fill the void of shuttered public schools.

day_66.headline: In the Coronavirus Fight in Scandinavia, Sweden Stands Apart
day_66.abstract: The country has drawn global attention with an unorthodox approach while its neighbors have imposed extensive restrictions.

day_66.headline: A Silent Spring Is Saying Something
day_66.abstract: The eerie inhumanity of Donald Trump.

day_66.headline: 'Just One Case': Fears Coronavirus May Spread Like Wildfire in World's Refugee Camps
day_66.abstract: In the world’s largest refugee settlement in Bangladesh, filmmaker Mohammed Arafat has been making public safety videos to warn about the dangers of coronavirus.

day_66.headline: How the Young Deal With the Coronavirus
day_66.abstract: High school and college students urge their cohort to take the threat seriously, and adults reassure the young that past adversities and uncertainties have been overcome.

day_67.headline: Modi Seeks 'Forgiveness' From India's Poor Over Coronavirus Lockdown

day_67.headline: German Health Institute Warns Pandemic Could Overstretch System - Paper
day_67.abstract: Germany's health system could face strains similar to those in Italy if the coronavirus outbreak in the country worsens, the head of the Robert Koch Institute (RKI), the federal agency responsible for disease control, told a newspaper.

day_67.abstract: Ugandan pop star and opposition leader Bobi Wine, who released a song urging Africa's people to wash their hands to stop the spread of the new coronavirus, is criticizing African governments for not maintaining better health care systems for the continent's 1.3 billion people.

day_67.abstract: Millions of migrant laborers in Indian cities live and eat where they work, and the sudden shutdown of businesses has upended their lives. Anger is rising.

day_67.headline: Oil Prices Crash, Virus Hits, Commerce Stops: Iraq Is in Trouble.
day_67.abstract: Iraq depends on oil revenues, which have plummeted. The country is so desperate it is asking for donations to help it weather the pandemic.

day_67.headline: Coronavirus Live Updates: Pelosi Accuses Trump of ‘Deadly’ Denial; New York Mayor Says Medical Supplies Will Run Out in a Week
day_67.abstract: The world largest lockdown brings chaos and hunger to India, and the global tally of cases rises past 670,000. A U.S. judge orders migrant children released.

day_68.headline: Red Bull's Marko Suggested 'Corona Camp' for F1 Drivers
day_68.abstract: Red Bull's motorsport head Helmut Marko suggested his Formula One and junior drivers should catch the coronavirus while racing is on hold so they would be protected from sickness later in the year.

day_68.headline: In Jerusalem, a Palestinian Family Under Coronavirus Lockdown
day_68.abstract: A Palestinian English teacher, Jizelle Sara, faces a double challenge while observing a partial lockdown in her Jerusalem home during the coronavirus crisis.

day_68.abstract: Despite leaders’ decrees on staying home, laborers who live hand-to-mouth say they have no choice but to keep hitting the streets. Here are their stories.

day_68.abstract: Bans on the short-selling of shares when stock markets are experiencing extreme volatility gives the impression of a decisive response without achieving any useful result, the World Federation of Exchanges (WFE) said on Monday.

day_68.abstract: Israeli police have used a drone, helicopter and stun grenades in recent days to prevent people gathering in an ultra-Orthodox Jewish neighborhood of Jerusalem in defiance of Health Ministry measures aimed at slowing the spread of the coronavirus.

day_68.headline: Coronavirus Hits Rich and Poor Unequally in Latin America

day_68.abstract: Failure to comply with government restrictions is causing the coronavirus to spread in ultra-Orthodox communities up to eight times faster than elsewhere in Israel.

day_68.headline: The Quarantine Diaries
day_68.abstract: Around the world, the history of our present moment is taking shape in journal entries and drawings.

day_69.headline: A Coronavirus Thriller Was Finished Just Before the Shutdown
day_69.abstract: A Canadian filmmaker read the headlines, and a few weeks later a shoot was underway on a story addressing xenophobia and the pandemic. Then film festivals were canceled.

day_69.headline: Germany Faces Big Growth Hit in First Half, Second-Half Recovery Possible: Minister
day_69.abstract: The German economy faces a major setback in the March-May period but there is still a chance it could make up some of that lost ground in the second half of the year, Economy Minister Peter Altmaier told the Rheinische Post newspaper.

day_69.abstract: The health crisis, which has become a fresh test of survival for a country where life has been a daily fight for decades, has provoked a shared sense of responsibility and spontaneous acts of generosity.

day_69.headline: India and Pakistan Crack Down on Muslim Group Emerging as COVID-19 Cluster
day_69.abstract: India and Pakistan sealed off centers belonging to a Muslim missionary group on Tuesday and began investigating how many coronavirus cases were linked to its activities.

day_69.abstract: A study published last fall went unheeded. One of its authors now says economic shutdowns to fight the coronavirus could last up to eight months.

day_69.headline: How ‘Unorthodox’ Captured One Woman’s Flight From Hasidic Brooklyn
day_69.abstract: Deborah Feldman left her ultra-Orthodox Jewish community for a new life in Berlin. She talked about what it has been like having her autobiography adapted for Netflix.

day_69.headline: 'It Is Brutal': Hollywood's Rank-And-File on the Pandemic
day_69.abstract: The red carpets are rolled up in storage, the A-listers holed up in mansions, multiplex doors are closed. For now, at least, the coronavirus has shut down much of Hollywood. And for the entertainment industry's many one-gig-at-a-time staff and freelance workers — a quarter-million people in Los Angeles County alone — it's an economic disaster.

day_69.headline: With the Coronavirus, It’s Again Trump vs. Mother Nature
day_69.abstract: The president’s failure to understand his limits is very costly.

day_69.abstract: Reza Khandan got the word from friends locked away in Iran’s most feared prison, Evin. A prisoner and a guard in their cell block had been removed because they were suspected of having coronavirus, and two guards in the women’s ward had shown symptoms.

day_69.headline: Venezuela Fuel Shortages Hinder Food Delivery Amid Coronavirus Quarantine
day_69.abstract: Venezuela's fuel shortages are causing growing complications for the production and delivery of food to a crisis-stricken nation that is in quarantine to stop the spread of the coronavirus, according to ten food industry sources.

day_70.headline: A Month of Coronavirus in New York City: See the Hardest-Hit Areas
day_70.abstract: New data released by the city shows that lower-income neighborhoods have been most affected by the virus.

day_70.headline: 44 Texas Students Have Coronavirus After Spring Break Trip
day_70.abstract: A group of about 70 students from the University of Texas at Austin celebrated spring break in Mexico, then returned to find that dozens had tested positive.

day_70.headline: Coronavirus Misbehavior: When Was Licking a Toilet Ever a Good Idea?
day_70.abstract: The coronavirus pandemic has brought fear, panic and pranksters. In some cases, bad behavior has crossed the line into criminal terrorist acts.

day_70.abstract: A boom in Denmark's economy may be replaced by a contraction of as much as 10% this year as the coronavirus outbreak hits the Nordic economy, the country's central bank said on Wednesday.

day_70.abstract: The EU executive proposed on Wednesday a wage-subsidy scheme to encourage employers to cut workers' hours rather than their jobs amid the coronavirus epidemic, a plan that could be worth 100 billion euros in borrowing guaranteed by all EU countries.

day_70.abstract: The U.N. Security Council urged Afghanistan’s warring parties on Tuesday to heed the U.N. secretary-general’s call for an immediate cease-fire to respond to the COVID-19 pandemic and ensure delivery of humanitarian aid throughout the country.

day_70.headline: Virus Outbreak Creates New Challenges for Addiction Recovery
day_70.abstract: Charlie Campbell, nearly 13 years sober, is feeling tested today more than ever to stay that way.

day_70.headline: ‘We Are the Silent First Responders’: The Workers Who Make America Work
day_70.abstract: Exposed and afraid but determined, workers who have no choice but to confront the pandemic describe their changed world in their own words.

day_71.headline: Germans Snitch on Neighbours Flouting Virus Rules, in Echo of the Stasi Past
day_71.abstract: Law-abiding Germans are zealously helping police crack down on  people flouting new social distancing rules aimed at slowing the spread of the coronavirus by reporting on strangers, neighbours and friends.

day_71.headline: Nivea-Maker Beiersdorf Scraps 2020 Outlook Due to Coronavirus Crisis
day_71.abstract: Nivea-maker Beiersdorf on Thursday scrapped its 2020 outlook due to the coronavirus pandemic, and also released preliminary first-quarter sales that showed a 3.6% fall from a year earlier.

day_71.abstract: The coronavirus pandemic has hit especially hard in a few poorer New York City neighborhoods where telecommuting isn’t an option for many workers and there are more likely to be many people living under one roof.

day_71.headline: Kill the Virus, Not Democracy-EU Tells Hungary
day_71.abstract: The European Commission told Hungary's Prime Minister Viktor Orban on Thursday that emergency powers he has assumed to combat the coronavirus outbreak risk upending democracy and must be subject to proper parliamentary and media scrutiny.

day_71.headline: Residents Snitch on Businesses, Neighbors Amid Shutdowns
day_71.abstract: One Tulsa, Oklahoma, bar owner said more than a dozen motorcyclists showed up unannounced, but he served them a round of shots anyway to celebrate a birthday. Another live-streamed a drag queen show on Facebook while up to 20 people drank inside the locked bar, ignoring police when they knocked on the door.

day_71.headline: The World’s Great Photographers, Many Stuck Inside, Have Snapped
day_71.abstract: Stephen Shore, Catherine Opie, Todd Hido and others have turned to Instagram to cure ‘corona claustrophobia’ or show how life has changed. They talk about their quarantine pics.

day_71.headline: Ex-Wife Sick. Daughter Sick. 3 Friends Dead. Everyone Knows Someone.
day_71.abstract: The growing number of coronavirus cases and deaths have touched family and social circles across New York City, making the invisible threat seem far more real.

day_71.headline: Exclusive: How Elite U.S. College Students Brought Covid-19 Home From Campus
day_71.abstract: Like many American colleges, Vanderbilt University in Nashville announced last month it was closing its dormitories and putting classes online because of the growing threat of coronavirus. It said it was acting "out of an abundance of caution" after a local healthcare worker had tested positive for the disease.

day_71.headline: EU Consumers May Be Able to Bring Dieselgate Claims in Home Court: Adviser
day_71.abstract: EU consumers should be able to sue carmakers in their national courts if they have bought cars with emission cheat devices installed, an adviser to the Court of Justice of the European Union said on Thursday.

day_72.headline: Corona Beer to Halt Production Amid Coronavirus Outbreak
day_72.abstract: The suspension was announced days after the Mexican government ordered nonessential businesses to close.

day_72.headline: Take Five: Life in the Time of Corona
Mexico Without Corona: Brewers Suspend Production During Pandemic
day_72.abstract: Mexicans fretted about beer supplies on Friday after Dutch brewer Heineken said it will suspend production at its seven plants in Mexico to comply with coronavirus containment measures, following a similar announcement by rival Modelo.

day_72.headline: Mexico Stops Brewing Corona Beer, Deemed Non-Essential in Epidemic
day_72.abstract: Mexico's Grupo Modelo said on Thursday it will temporarily stop brewing Corona beer and other brands exported to 180 countries after its business activities were declared non-essential under a government order aimed at curbing the spread of the  coronavirus.

day_72.headline: Constellation Brands Says Mexico Breweries Still Running Amid Coronavirus Outbreak
day_72.abstract: Constellation Brands Inc, the U.S. distributor of Corona beer, said on Friday its Mexican breweries were still operational and supply to the United States was intact even as rivals suspended production due to the coronavirus pandemic.

day_72.headline: Walmart Limits Store Access; US Airlines Sign Up for Grants
day_72.abstract: The outbreak of the coronavirus has dealt a shock to the global economy with unprecedented speed. Following are developments on Friday related to the global economy, the work place and the spread of the virus.

day_72.headline: EU Open to All Options to Finance Coronavirus Fight: Dombrovskis
day_72.abstract: The European Union's executive is open to all options to fight the coronavirus emergency, Commission vice president Valdis Dombrovskis told Italian daily La Repubblica when asked if Brussels favoured eurobonds.

day_72.headline: Masks Do Reduce Spread of Flu and Some Coronaviruses, Study Finds
day_72.abstract: Face masks could help limit the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic, according to researchers who studied the effect of surgical masks on the transmission of other corona and flu viruses.

day_72.headline: Hungary's Orban Strikes Back at EU Criticism on Extra Powers
day_72.abstract: Hungary’s prime minister struck back at his critics in the European Union, saying he has “no time” for dealing with some of them during the coronavirus pandemic and accusing others of wanting to “loot” the country.

day_72.headline: The Imperative of Personal Sacrifice, Today and During World War II
day_72.abstract: Are Americans as willing to making sacrifices today in response to the coronavirus, compared to in the 1940s? A historian explains.

day_73.headline: Contagious Singing as Corona Community Chorus Unites Voices
day_73.abstract: Casper ter Kuile lights a candle in front of his computer screen. And then the music begins.

day_73.headline: A German Exception? Why the Country’s Coronavirus Death Rate Is Low
day_73.abstract: The pandemic has hit Germany hard, with more than 92,000 people infected. But the percentage of fatal cases has been remarkably low compared to those in many neighboring countries.

day_73.headline: All I Wanted Was to Be Interrogated
day_73.abstract: On a reporter’s 27-hour journey from Hong Kong to New York City, hardly anyone seemed to care about her health.

day_73.headline: Coronavirus in America: A Highlight Reel
day_73.abstract: More than half of humankind is putting life on hold so that others may live. We asked readers to share the moments that are inspiring them through a time of crisis.

day_73.headline: Larry David, Master of His Quarantine
day_73.abstract: Who better than the father of “Seinfeld” and “Curb Your Enthusiasm” to guide us through the thicket of being together, alone?

day_74.headline: Lebanese Stranded Abroad by Coronavirus Outbreak Return Home
day_74.abstract: Several flights carrying Lebanese stranded abroad by coronavirus lockdowns began arriving in Beirut on Sunday, part of a trial run to see whether thousands looking to come home can be safely repatriated without worsening the country's outbreak.

day_74.headline: I’m a Doctor at the ‘Epicenter of the Epicenter’
day_74.abstract: Let’s not forget the social failures that allowed Covid-19 to overwhelm neighborhoods like Elmhurst in Queens.

day_74.headline: Virus Cancels Anniversary Event for Deadly Mine Explosion
day_74.abstract: A planned public gathering was shelved on the 10th anniversary of the worst U.S. mining disaster in decades. Heartfelt speeches gave way Sunday to silent remembrances and individual prayers for the 29 men who died at the Upper Big Branch mine in West Virginia.

day_74.headline: 'Complete Collapse of Economies' Ahead as Africa Faces Virus
day_74.abstract: Some of Uganda’s poorest people used to work here, on the streets of Kampala, as fruit sellers sitting on the pavement or as peddlers of everything from handkerchiefs to roasted peanuts.

day_74.headline: Of Beards and Bubonic Plague: German Village Prays for a (2nd) Miracle
day_74.abstract: In 1633 the Bavarian village of Oberammergau, ravaged by a pandemic, made a pledge to God. Now another pandemic has forced villagers to abandon their promise.

day_75.headline: Jamie Dimon Expects a ‘Bad Recession’
day_75.abstract: The pandemic “is only one example of the bad planning and management that have hurt our country,” the JPMorgan C.E.O. wrote in his latest shareholder letter.

day_75.headline: Americans Don’t Trust the Media Anymore. So Why Do They Trust the Cuomos?
day_75.abstract: CNN once prevented Chris Cuomo from interviewing his brother on the air. But that all changed with the arrival of the coronavirus, and now it’s changing television, too.

day_75.headline: How Gig Workers Are Weathering the Virus Shutdown
day_75.abstract: Meet a few of the millions of people in New York — a day laborer, production assistant and catering business owner — who have seen their freelance and events-based work dry up.

day_76.headline: Lessons From the Plagues, Painted for Passover
day_76.abstract: The artist Zoya Cherkassky evokes Jewish life in the shtetl in her new virtual exhibition.

day_76.headline: ‘What Rhymes With Purell?’ Franglais Rappers Push Language Boundaries in Quebec
day_76.abstract: Critics in Montreal say hip-hop artists mixing French and English are threatening the future of the French language in the majority Francophone province.

day_76.headline: We Can Still Travel — With Photoshop and a Dream
day_76.abstract: There’s little choice now but to stay grounded because of the coronavirus, but avid travelers are devising creative and meaningful ways to celebrate the vacations they have had to cancel.

day_77.headline: American Ballet Theater Cancels Spring Season at Met Opera House
day_77.abstract: Canceling the Met season, the company’s executive director said, is “akin to the cancellation of the Olympics for those athletes.”

day_77.headline: Coronavirus and the Cancer Patient
day_77.abstract: My patients’ immune systems are so exquisitely fragile that it doesn’t take much to catch an infection that could kill them.

day_77.headline: House Hunting in Mexico: A Balinese-Style Compound for $595,000
day_77.abstract: The artsy town of Todos Santos has long been a quiet alternative to the resorts of Los Cabos, but new demand and development is raising its profile.

day_77.headline: As Europe Confronts the Coronavirus, What Shape Will Solidarity Take?
day_77.abstract: Contentious talks over how to help economies decimated by the virus have become a pivotal political moment for the world’s richest bloc of nations.

day_77.headline: Jack Dorsey Ups the Ante on Coronavirus Donations

day_117.headline: Germany’s Coronavirus Protests: Anti-Vaxxers, Anticapitalists, Neo-Nazis
day_117.abstract: The pandemic marginalized the far right, as Germans rallied behind Angela Merkel. But the reopening has brought them back, and they are preparing to seize new opportunities.

day_117.headline: SoftBank Racks Up Losses as Vision Fund Investments Plunge
day_117.abstract: Japanese technology company SoftBank Group Corp. racked up a loss of 961.6 billion yen ($9 billion) for the fiscal year through March, on red ink related to its Vision Fund investments including troubled office space-sharing venture WeWork.

day_117.headline: Iran Sees New Surge in Virus Cases After Reopening Country
day_117.abstract: Health experts say the government did not heed the warnings about easing restrictions too soon. Cases spike in eight provinces.

day_117.headline: SoftBank in Crisis Amid Record Losses
day_117.abstract: Its flagship tech fund is underwater, annual losses are huge and a key board member departed, as the firm faces the coronavirus and a tech slump.

day_117.headline: No ‘Prairie Home Companion’ at Sea, and So Far, No Refund, Either
day_117.abstract: Garrison Keillor’s cruise was to set sail in March. Loyal fans out thousands of dollars are still scrambling to determine if they will get their money back — and if so, how much.

day_117.headline: Brooklyn ZIP Code Has N.Y.C.’s Highest Death Rate
day_117.abstract: The 10 ZIP codes with the highest virus-related death rates in New York City are primarily home to black, Hispanic and immigrant New Yorkers, new data shows.

day_118.headline: Europe Risks Being Left Behind China, U.S. by Coronavirus: Siemens CEO
day_118.abstract: The coronavirus pandemic could damage European competitiveness by accelerating the economic dominance of the United States and China, Siemens Chief Executive Joe Kaeser warned.

day_118.headline: Austria Insists on Virus Aid Loans Instead of Grants: Die Presse
day_118.abstract: Austria insists that the European Union's emergency aid for coronavirus-hit member states should be based on repayable loans not grants, Austrian daily Die Presse said on Tuesday, citing the Chancellery.

day_118.headline: GOP Fronts 'Pro-Trump' Doctors to Prescribe Rapid Reopening
day_118.abstract: Republican political operatives are recruiting “extremely pro-Trump” doctors to go on television to prescribe reviving the U.S. economy as quickly as possible, without waiting to meet safety benchmarks proposed by the federal Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to slow the spread of the new coronavirus.

day_118.headline: Car Parts Maker Benteler's Move Out of Germany Haunts State Aid Hopes
day_118.abstract: Car parts' maker Benteler's move from Germany to Austria in 2010 cut its tax bill but may now create a hurdle as the company seeks to access state support during the coronavirus crisis.

day_118.headline: Late Night: Who Could Obama Possibly Have Been Talking About?
day_118.abstract: As Trevor Noah noticed, Barack Obama didn’t mention any names when he criticized the coronavirus response, but supporters of President Trump took offense anyway.

day_118.headline: Venezuela Files Claim to Force Bank of England to Hand Over Gold
day_118.abstract: Venezuela's central bank has made a legal claim to try to force the Bank of England to hand over €930 million ($1.02 billion) of gold so President Nicolas Maduro's government can fund its coronavirus response, according to the document submitted in a London court.

day_119.headline: Lives Lost: 'A Nightmare,' Says Parishioner Who Lost Parents
day_119.abstract: Reyna Martinez kept silent when the coronavirus killed her mother. She would hide in a bathroom and cry to keep the secret from her father.

day_119.headline: Cash, Long a Refuge in Uncertain Times, Now Under Suspicion
day_119.abstract: In troubled times, people have been known to hoard currency at home — a financial security blanket against deep uncertainty. But in this crisis, things are different. This time cash itself, passed from hand to hand across neighborhoods, cities and societies just like the coronavirus, is a source of suspicion rather than reassurance.

day_119.headline: Utah's Conley Waiting for News, Like the Rest of the NBA
day_119.abstract: Mike Conley is waiting for further instructions. So is the rest of the NBA.

day_119.headline: Personal Foul: Hair Cut
day_119.abstract: Top athletes are getting in trouble for getting haircuts. Plus, the Australian “Bonk Ban” and the return of the Persian Gulf Pro League.

day_119.headline: College Calendars in the Pandemic: No Fall Break and Home by Thanksgiving
day_119.abstract: As universities announce plans to bring back students, a pattern is emerging: shorter semesters to avoid late-fall infections.

day_119.headline: How a Queens Pastor Tends to His Flock From Six Feet Away
day_119.abstract: After recovering from the coronavirus, the Rev. Peter Purpura found a way to bring the church directly to his people.

day_119.headline: Sleepless and Going Broke: Riding Out Coronavirus Alone
day_119.abstract: Najee Wilson is a 32-year-old artist’s muse who is quarantining alone in Crown Heights. Unable to work or see his friends, his video diary documents what it means to find a new virtual community while organizing a rent strike.

day_119.headline: Janelle Monáe Touches Down in ‘Homecoming’
day_119.abstract: The intergalactically attuned pop singer and star of films like “Moonlight” and “Hidden Figures” continues to expand her horizons as an actor, playing the lead in the new season of the Amazon thriller.

day_119.headline: Your Thursday Briefing
day_119.abstract: Xi Jinping, vaccine, Cyclone Amphan: Here’s what you need to know.

day_119.headline: He Was Thriving in New York’s Art Scene. The Virus Changed Everything.
day_119.abstract: Najee Wilson, an artist and muse living in Brooklyn, ponders the future of his New York dream, now derailed by Covid-19.

day_120.headline: Chafing Under Lockdown, Palestinians Long for Eid Celebrations
day_120.abstract: Bethlehem is struggling back to life just in time for the Muslim holiday of Eid al-Fitr, nearly three months after it became the first town in the West Bank to be sealed off because of a coronavirus outbreak.

day_120.headline: Visually Impaired Nigerians Struggle to Navigate Coronavirus Challenges
day_120.abstract: Lawal Adebimpe knows she must remain a safe distance from people to help prevent the spread of the novel coronavirus in Nigeria. But her blindness means she usually holds people to navigate her way around the heaving megacity of Lagos.

day_120.headline: Would-Be Merkel Successor Warns Against EU 'Transfer Union'
day_120.abstract: The European Union must be careful not to become a "transfer union" in which richer member states are asked to bankroll their poorer peers, a leading candidate to succeed German Chancellor Angela Merkel told Reuters.

day_120.headline: Vaccines, U.S. Reopenings, Flour Frenzy: Your Thursday Briefing
day_120.abstract: Here’s what you need to know.

day_120.headline: Spike Lee and the Battlefield of American History
day_120.abstract: With his new film, the peerless American filmmaker — self-isolating and reflective in New York — unsettles past and present conflicts.

day_120.headline: What Students Are Saying About Online Test Proctoring, Favorite Books and Driving Tests
day_120.abstract: Teenage comments in response to our recent writing prompts, and an invitation to join the ongoing conversation.

day_121.headline: The Coronavirus Quieted City Noise. Listen to What’s Left.
day_121.abstract: Microphones on once-busy street corners and public parks have recorded the sound of the pandemic.

day_121.headline: Biden-Warren: Really?
day_121.abstract: And what else you need to know today.

day_122.headline: Author Murakami DJs 'Stay Home' Radio Show to Lift Spirits
day_122.abstract: Acclaimed Japanese novelist Haruki Murakami, hosting a special radio show from home, painted a brighter side of the world with his favorite music, and said the fight against the coronavirus is a challenge in figuring out ways to help and care for each other.

day_122.headline: Balcony Church Gains Popularity in Kenya Amid Pandemic
day_122.abstract: A groovy rendition of “He's Got the Whole World in His Hands” blasts from speakers outside an apartment block in the outskirts of Kenya's capital, Nairobi.

day_122.headline: N.B.A. in Talks to Resume Season at Walt Disney World Resort
day_122.abstract: The league is in discussions with its players’ union and the Walt Disney Company about restarting its season — suspended since March 11 — at the Orlando-based resort in late July.

day_122.headline: Covid Dreams, Trump Nightmares
day_122.abstract: Of masks, unmasking and dropping our professional masks for our medical ones.

day_122.headline: European Defense and ‘Strategic Autonomy’ Are Also Coronavirus Victims
day_122.abstract: With governments under intense spending pressure to cope with the coronavirus, European ambitions for a more independent defense are facing the chop.

day_122.headline: Pandemic Swells in South America, as the U.S. Nears 100,000 Deaths
day_122.abstract: Gaza reports its first coronavirus death. New York is allowing gatherings of up to 10.

day_123.headline: Haiti Voodoo Leaders Prepare Temples for Coronavirus Sufferers
day_123.abstract: Haiti's voodoo leaders have trained priests of the Afro Caribbean religion to concoct a secret remedy for the novel coronavirus and to prepare the sacred initiation chambers of their temples to receive patients.

day_123.headline: The Latest: Japan Set to End Tokyo's State of Emergency
day_123.abstract: The Latest on the coronavirus pandemic. The new coronavirus causes mild or moderate symptoms for most people. For some, especially older adults and people with existing health problems, it can cause more severe illness or death.
